Levothyroxine

Counseling Pearls

  • Take with a full glass of water on an empty stomach, 30 to 60 minutes before the first meal of the day. Food interrupts the absorption of levothyroxine.
  • Levels of thyroid hormone take time to adjust in the body. Patients should visit with a provider to have their levels checked within a few months after starting the medication to determine that the dose is effective.
  • Side effects typically stem from excess thyroid hormone in the body. If patients do experience side effects, have them follow up with their doctor.

Side Effects

  • Diarrhea
  • Increased Appetite
  • Heat Intolerance
  • Irritability
  • Flushing

Description

Levothyroxine is a synthetic analog of T4, which is normally produced by the thyroid gland. T4 is converted into T3 via deiodination in peripheral tissues, where it has its physiologic mechanism of action to increase gene transcription.

Levothyroxine has a relatively long half-life of 6-7 days, and is degraded in the liver and excreted by the kidneys through normal physiological processes.

 

Citations

  1. Synthroid (levothyroxine) [package insert]. Chicago, IL: Abbott Laboratories; 2005. (https://www.accessdata.fda.gov/drugsatfda_docs/label/2008/021402s011lbl.pdf)
